content:
hey @WG-triage, the meeting this month will be held at 2020-08-05T18:00:00+02:00 . I've sent out calendar invites, if you haven't received or wish to subscribe out of the invites or the meetings in future, you can let me know.

The agenda for the meeting is https://hackmd.io/DZ2q4BlpRkSyf4RUxtil9g and members are free to add items to the agenda to be discussed.

(forgot to check the title when sending out the invites, so it may have the wrong one at first, fixed later)

Could I get a calendar invite please? :)

whoops, I have one, I was looking in the wrong place
@WG-triage meeting time :smile:
react with :wave: if you are around :stuck_out_tongue:
this is going to be a short meeting as not much to be discussed
last month we had changed the schedule because @Owen Salter wasn't available to triage on Saturdays, and given that they are not around today
we will stick to the same schedule till the next meeting (same schedule as july)
Hi I'm here sorry
oops :grinning:
no worries
do you want to stick to the new schedule or go back to the older one?
The current schedule works but I'm available on Saturdays now

okay so from Monday (10.08) we can revert back the original schedule:
monday - @JohnCSimon
tues - @JoelPalmer
wed - @Alex Macleod
thurs - @Elinvynia
fri - @crlf0710
sat - @Muirrum
sun - @huyuumi / vacant
let this week continue as usual since we are halfway through to avoid confusion
if anyone wants to shift dates, you can let me know we can arrange accordingly
moving on...
anyone has any feedback or concerns to bring up?
just a reminder, if you skip any prs, better to put it in the report as well, it makes it easier to know what's been triaged or not
the last point on the agenda -
so we have issues that are claimed are users via the bot: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/assigned/rustbot
now sometimes people claim issues and haven't worked on them for a while but the "claim" remains so others can't pick it up
so if a user has claimed it, and there is no pr after 2-3 weeks, you can ping them asking if there's an update and if not you can unclaim the issue (via the bot)
we don't need to do this every day, so if 1 person does it every week that should be sufficient
any volunteers? :stuck_out_tongue:
I can do that
you can do it in batches per week as well, not an issue
do you have any questions regarding it?
you can ask them for updates, and then the next week when you triage those again, if they have replied you can unclaim or ignore it accordingly
this is in cases only where there isn't a pr made against the issue by the author
Yeah I think I'll do it like so. Don't have any questions (yet)
cool.
you can skip triaging pull requests if you don't have the time to do both. that's fine
so that's the end of the agenda, anyone wants to bring up any issue?
the agenda doc will remain the same for all our meetings, so if you have anything during the month you wish to discuss, you can open a thread here or add it to the agenda
unless something changes last minute, our next meeting will be on 02.09.2020 at same time. The invites are recurring so you should have it on your calendars :grinning:
i think that's it for today. Have a safe month :smile:
and thanks for all the work
